resources.string: CamCOPS: Cambridge Cognitive and Psychiatric Assessment Kit
By Rudolf Cardinal. See camcops.org for user guide and server software.
You must agree to the following terms and conditions in order to use CamCOPS.

1. By using the Cambridge Cognitive and Psychiatric Assessment Kit application or web interface (“CamCOPS”), you are agreeing in full to these Terms and Conditions of Use. If you do not agree to these terms, do not use the software.

2. Content that is original to CamCOPS is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the “License”); you may not use this software except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at

 http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an “AS IS” BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License.

3. Content created by others and distributed with CamCOPS may be in the public domain, or distributed under other licenses or permissions. THERE MAY BE CRITERIA THAT APPLY TO YOU THAT MEAN YOU ARE NOT PERMITTED TO USE SPECIFIC TASKS. IT IS YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO CHECK THAT YOU ARE LEGALLY ENTITLED TO USE EACH TASK. The authors of CamCOPS will not be held responsible for any consequences that arise from your use of an unauthorized task.

4. While efforts have been made to ensure that CamCOPS is reliable and accurate, the authors and distributors of CamCOPS are not responsible for errors, omissions, or defects in the content, nor liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special and/or consequential damages, in whole or in part, resulting from your use or any user’s use of or reliance upon its content.

5. Content contained in or accessed through CamCOPS should not be relied upon for medical purposes in any way. This software is not designed for use by the general public. If medical advice is required you should seek expert medical assistance.

6. Regarding the European Union Council Directive 93/42/EEC of 14 June 1993 concerning medical devices (amended by further directives up to and including Directive 2007/47/EC of 5 September 2007) (“Medical Devices Directive”): CamCOPS is not intended primarily for the diagnosis and/or monitoring of human disease. If it is used for such purposes, it must be used EXCLUSIVELY FOR CLINICAL INVESTIGATIONS in an appropriate setting by persons professionally qualified to do so. It has NOT undergone a conformity assessment under the Medical Devices Directive, and thus cannot be marketed or put into service as a medical device.

7. THIS SOFTWARE IS NOT DESIGNED FOR USE BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC. BY CONTINUING TO USE THIS SOFTWARE YOU ARE CONFIRMING THAT YOU ARE A CLINICIAN, AND THAT YOU RETAIN RESPONSIBILITY FOR DIAGNOSIS AND MANAGEMENT.

These terms and conditions were last revised on 2014-09-05.

You must set Privileged Mode first
No summary available; see the facsimile instead
Optional — Examiner’s comments (e.g. difficulties the subject had with the task):
Chain of tasks. Touch to run all the tasks in sequence.
Date, e.g. DD Month YYYY or YYYY-MM-DD
Date/time, e.g. DD Month YYYY HH:MM or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM
Press the NEXT button (the green right-facing arrow at the TOP RIGHT of the screen) to continue.
Global function and multiple aspects of psychopathology
Sets of tasks collected together for clinical purposes
Sets of tasks collected together for research purposes
Delete this patient? The patient has data for
Another patient exists on this tablet with the same ID values for:
This patient’s information doesn’t fulfil the server’s uploading ID policy of:
You can save and continue temporarily, but you will have to edit this patient to comply with the server’s ID policy before you will be able to upload.
This patient’s information doesn’t fulfil the server’s finalizing ID policy of:

You can save, and you will be able to upload a temporary copy, but you will have to edit this patient to comply with the server’s ID policy before you will be able to finalize (move) data to the server.
Does not yet meet tablet’s minimum ID requirements [sex plus either forename/surname/DOB or an ID number].
Does not yet meet server’s upload ID requirements
Does not yet meet server’s finalizing ID requirements
Re-accept ID descriptions from the server
Re-fetch extra task strings from the server
(†) Register this device with the server
(†) Send local database to tablet USB debugging stream
(†) Dump local database to SQL file (Android only)
(†) Run software unit tests (reporting to USB debugging stream)
(†) Wipe extra strings downloaded from server
Extra strings wiped. Re-download them if necessary.
Tutorial and illustration of questionnaire task elements
Are you sure you want to edit this existing task record?
Test network latency to Whisker server
Enter password to set Privileged Mode:
Enter new password to set privileged mode:
Re-enter new password to set privileged mode:

Copy data to server, or move it to server?
COPY: copies unfinished patients, moves finished patients.
MOVE: moves all patients and their data.
MOVE, KEEPING PATIENTS: moves all task data, keeps only basic patient details for unfinished patients.
Please MOVE whenever possible; this reduces the amount of patient-identifiable information stored on this device.
Task finished. Upload data to server now?
Data preserved on server and deleted from tablet device.
No server information specified! Need host, port, path.
patient(s) do not meet the server’s upload ID policy of:
patient(s) do not meet the server’s finalizing ID policy of:
Communication with server failed OR this device is not registered with the server OR tablet version too old
Table(s) that would have been uploaded (BUT WERE NOT):
Offer to upload every time a task is edited?
Server ID descriptions do not match those on the tablet. Accept them manually (Settings → Accept ID descriptions...) and check your patient IDs carefully, then upload again.
Registration succeeded but download of extra strings failed.

It’s best to ACCEPT the server’s ID descriptions; otherwise, your tablet will be using different IDs to the server. (You should only consider not accepting if you have existing patient information on the tablet, in which case accepting may change the ID descriptions; upload to a different server or manually edit each patient’s IDs, then re-register and accept.)

BEWARE EDITING WHAT FOLLOWS. Instead, register with a server and accept the server’s ID descriptions; that way, the tablet and server will match. EDITING WHAT FOLLOWS SHOULD ONLY BE DONE IN EXCEPTIONAL CIRCUMSTANCES AND BY EXPERTS.
Server details have changed. You should consider re-registering with the server.
Attempted to get ID info from:
Attempted to get extra strings from:
Are you SURE you want to export the database to a file?\n\nThis is a security risk: other applications will then be able to see the data.
External storage (e.g. SD card) not installed
Server path to CamCOPS scripts, e.g. camcops
Validate SSL certificates? (Should always be YES for security-conscious systems.)
Store user’s server password? (NO = more secure, YES = more convenient/less secure.)

Send analytics to CamCOPS base? (We’d very much appreciate you saying yes; it allows us to support users better. No patient-identifiable information, per-patient information, or task details are sent. See the documentation for details.)
Make multiline text fields appear with a fixed height while editing? (YES = faster, NO = better looking. Improves keyboard responsiveness on iPad; usually unnecessary on Android.)
Number of lines shown for fixed-height multiline fields

Sound test for Cardinal RN / Expectation–Detection task
Plays the auditory background sound. (Use maximum device volume. Should be 60.0 dB(A).)
Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust, UK — affective disorders
Deakin JB, University of Cambridge, UK — antibody-mediated psychosis
Framework for Routine Outcome Measurement in Liaison Psychiatry (FROM-LP)
O’Brien JT, University of Cambridge, UK — dementia research clinic
Health review for antibody-mediated psychosis study
Thank you! Please touch here to exit.
Are you sure you want to abort?
Are you sure you want to delete this photo?
World Health Organization; 10-item clinician-administered screening test.
3-item consumption subset of the AUDIT; clinician-administered screening test.
Bristol Activities of Daily Living Scale (BADLS) (¶+)
20-item carer-rated scale for use in dementia. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
21-item self-report scale. Data collection tool ONLY (for BDI, BDI-1A, BDI-II).
18-item clinician-administered rating of multiple aspects of psychopathology.
24-item clinician-administered rating of multiple aspects of psychopathology.
42-item self-rated scale for psychosis with positive, negative, and depressive dimensions.
Rapid assessment of auditory/visual thresholds (for expectation–detection task)

Set your tablet device’s brightness and volume BEFORE running this task, and DO NOT ALTER THEM in between runs or before completing the main Expectation–Detection task. Also, try to keep the lighting and background noise constant throughout.

Before you run the Expectation–Detection task for a given subject, please run this task FOUR times to determine the subject’s threshold for each of two auditory stimuli (tone, voice) and each of two auditory stimuli (circle, word).
Then, make a note of the 75% ("x75") threshold intensities for each stimulus, and start the Expectation–Detection task (which only needs to be run once). It will ask you for these four intensities.
Intensities and probabilities are in the range 0–1.
Number of trials in the main test sequence (e.g. 14)
When you’re ready, touch here to start.
Putative assay of proneness to hallucinations
You’ll need to set these parameters:
Configure these based on the results of the ExpDetThreshold task. (DO NOT alter your tablet device’s brightness or volume, or the environmental lighting/noise conditions.)
These parameters are less likely to need changing:
Pause every n trials (0 for no pausing):
Please ensure you can see and hear this tablet computer clearly.
The experimenter will assist you with any headphones required.
Once you have started the task, please follow the instructions that appear on the screen.
When you’re ready, touch here to continue.
Your score on this trial was:
Your total score so far is:
45-item caregiver rating scale, applicable to dementias.
Childhood Experience of Care and Abuse Questionnaire (CECA-Q3)
Family relationships in childhood. Version 3 with psychological abuse and role reversal.
Clinician-administered; briefly rates illness severity, global improvement, and efficacy/side-effect balance of treatment.
Clinical Global Impressions – Improvement subscale (CGI-I, FROM-LP version)
Clinician-administered; briefly rates illness severity and degree of change in four domains and overall.
Clinical Institute Withdrawal Assessment for Alcohol Scale, Revised (CIWA-Ar)
Referral to CPFT’s Liaison Psychiatry Service
Discharge from CPFT Liaison Psychiatry Service
Reset referral response clock (CPFT Liaison Psychiatry Service)
40-item clinician-administered, carer-rated scale. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
Dementia Quality of Life measure, self-report version (DEMQOL)
28-item interviewer-administered questionnaire answered by the person with dementia
Dementia Quality of Life measure, proxy version (DEMQOL-Proxy)
31-item interviewer-administered questionnaire answered by a caregiver
Single-tap to select “leaf” diagnosis and to proceed down “branches”. Double-tap to select a “branch” diagnosis itself.
Type in the search box to restrict. Tap to select a diagnosis.
Self-rating of overall distress, plus Y/N rating of a range of potential problems.
Single-question patient rating of a clinical service
30-item clinician-administered scale based on carer information. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
Single scale from 1–100. Data collection tool ONLY.
Questionnaire for patients to provide anonymous feedback to their doctors
14-item self-report scale. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS, HAM-D, HRSD)
21-item professional-administered depression scale commonly used for monitoring and research.
Health of the Nation Outcome Scales, working age adults (HoNOS)
Health of the Nation Outcome Scales, older adults (HoNOS 65+)
Health of the Nation Outcome Scales, Children and Adolescents (HoNOSCA)
World Health Organization International Classification of Diseases, 10th edition
ICD-10 criteria for specific personality disorders (F60)
ICD-10 symptomatic criteria for a manic/hypomanic episode (as in e.g. F06.3, F25, F30, F31)
ICD-10 symptomatic criteria for a depressive episode (as in e.g. F06.3, F25, F31, F32, F33)
ICD-10 symptomatic criteria for a mixed affective episode (as in e.g. F06.3, F25, F38.00, F31.6)
Simple discrimination, reversal, compound discrimination, reversal, ID set shift, reversal, ED set shift, reversal. Dimensions of shape/colour/number.
22-item self-report scale. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
30-point clinician-administered assessment. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
Identify and Rate the Aim of the Contact (IRAC)
Clinician-specified aim of contact, and whether aim achieved
Movement Disorder Society-Sponsored Revision of the Unified Parkinson’s Disease Rating Scale (MDS-UPDRS) (¶)
Assessment of experiences of daily living and motor examination/complications. Data collection tool ONLY.
Estimation of premorbid IQ by reading irregular words
12-item carer-rated scale for use in dementia. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
Scale for positive (7 items) and negative symptoms of schizophrenia (7 items), and general psychopathology (16 items). Data collection tool ONLY.
Short rating of a clinical service received
7-item self-report scale. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
Self-scoring of 15 common somatic symptoms (relevant to somatoform disorders).
Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptoms, clinician rated, 16-item (QIDS-C16)
Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptoms, self report, 16-item (QIDS-SR16)
Time trade-off and response scale measures of quality of life.
Standard-gamble measure of quality of life.

Quality of Life Standard Gamble
 
 
Please choose the statement that best describes your current health state:
Both wheels seem about equal to me now
I am somewhere from 0% to 100% healthy
My current state is worse than being dead
Suppose you are offered two alternatives, represented by the two wheels below.

The FIXEDSIDE wheel represents you remaining in your current state of health for the rest of your life.\nThe LOTTERYSIDE wheel represents an experimental treatment. There is a chance that it will return you\nto full health for the rest of your life. However, there is also a chance that it will kill you instantly.

The FIXEDSIDE wheel represents a poison that would kill you instantly.
The LOTTERYSIDE wheel represents an experimental treatment. There is a chance that it will return you to full
health for the rest of your life. However, there is also a chance that you will remain in your current state
of health for the rest of your life.

The FIXEDSIDE wheel represents a medicine that would give you normal full health for the rest of your life.\nThe LOTTERYSIDE wheel represents an experimental treatment. There is a chance that it will keep you in your current\nstate of health for the rest of your life. However, there is also a chance that it will kill you instantly.
Please drag the red pointer to adjust the chances on the LOTTERYSIDE wheel, until the two wheels seem\nEQUAL IN VALUE to you. Then press the green button.
St Louis University Mental Status (SLUMS) Exam
Short rating of a clinical service received (survey)
Short rating of a clinical service received (patient-specific)
14 positively-phrased Likert-style items measuring mental well-being over the preceding 2 weeks
5-item self-report scale. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
10-item clinician-rated scale. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
Symptom checklist (past, current, principal) for Y-BOCS. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
12-item caregiver-report scale. Data collection tool ONLY unless host institution adds scale text.
